intro: Gnaphalium stracheyi, commonly known as the silky everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, fluffy appearance. Gnaphalium stracheyi is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
